text: <a href="../1-Timothy-1-1/" title="1 Timothy 1:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the commandment of God our Saviour, and Lord Jesus Christ, *which is* our hope;

<a href="../1-Timothy-1-2/" title="1 Timothy 1:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 Unto Timothy, *my* own son in the faith: Grace, mercy, *and* peace, from God our Father and Jesus Christ our Lord.

<a href="../1-Timothy-1-3/" title="1 Timothy 1:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 As I besought thee to abide still at Ephesus, when I went into Macedonia, that thou mightest charge some that they teach no other doctrine,

<a href="../1-Timothy-1-4/" title="1 Timothy 1:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 Neither give heed to fables and endless genealogies, which minister questions, rather than godly edifying which is in faith: *so do*.

<a href="../1-Timothy-1-5/" title="1 Timothy 1:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 Now the end of the commandment is charity out of a pure heart, and *of* a good conscience, and *of* faith unfeigned:
<a href="../1-Timothy-1-6/" title="1 Timothy 1:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 From which some having swerved have turned aside unto vain jangling;
<a href="../1-Timothy-1-7/" title="1 Timothy 1:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 Desiring to be teachers of the law; understanding neither what they say, nor whereof they affirm.
<a href="../1-Timothy-1-8/" title="1 Timothy 1:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 But we know that the law *is* good, if a man use it lawfully;

<a href="../1-Timothy-1-9/" title="1 Timothy 1:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 Knowing this, that the law is not made for a righteous man, but for the lawless and disobedient, for the ungodly and for sinners, for unholy and profane, for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers, for manslayers,

<a href="../1-Timothy-1-10/" title="1 Timothy 1:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 For whoremongers, for them that defile themselves with mankind, for menstealers, for liars, for perjured persons, and if there be any other thing that is contrary to sound doctrine;
<a href="../1-Timothy-1-11/" title="1 Timothy 1:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 According to the glorious gospel of the blessed God, which was committed to my trust.

<a href="../1-Timothy-1-12/" title="1 Timothy 1:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 And I thank Christ Jesus our Lord, who hath enabled me, for that he counted me faithful, putting me into the ministry;

<a href="../1-Timothy-1-13/" title="1 Timothy 1:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 Who was before a blasphemer, and a persecutor, and injurious: but I obtained mercy, because I did *it* ignorantly in unbelief.
<a href="../1-Timothy-1-14/" title="1 Timothy 1:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 And the grace of our Lord was exceeding abundant with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

<a href="../1-Timothy-1-15/" title="1 Timothy 1:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 This *is* a faithful saying, and worthy of all acceptation, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners; of whom I am chief.

<a href="../1-Timothy-1-16/" title="1 Timothy 1:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 Howbeit for this cause I obtained mercy, that in me first Jesus Christ might shew forth all longsuffering, for a pattern to them which should hereafter believe on him to life everlasting.

<a href="../1-Timothy-1-17/" title="1 Timothy 1:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 Now unto the King eternal, immortal, invisible, the only wise God, *be* honour and glory for ever and ever. Amen.

<a href="../1-Timothy-1-18/" title="1 Timothy 1:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 This charge I commit unto thee, son Timothy, according to the prophecies which went before on thee, that thou by them mightest war a good warfare;

<a href="../1-Timothy-1-19/" title="1 Timothy 1:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 Holding faith, and a good conscience; which some having put away concerning faith have made shipwreck:

<a href="../1-Timothy-1-20/" title="1 Timothy 1:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 Of whom is Hymenaeus and Alexander; whom I have delivered unto Satan, that they may learn not to blaspheme.
